alert.note: Alert for Clark; Floyd; Jefferson; Scott; Washington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 8:07AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Jefferson, Clark, Floyd, Scott, eastern Washington, southeastern Harrison, southwestern Oldham, west central Nelson, southeastern Meade, Larue, Hart, southeastern Grayson, Jefferson, Hardin, Bullitt, northeastern Edmonson, northeastern Barren and northwestern Metcalfe Counties through 845 AM EDT/745 AM CDT/... At 806 AM EDT/706 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Scottsburg to 9 miles east of Brownsville. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of western Jefferson, Scott, eastern Washington, Floyd, Clark and southeastern Harrison Counties in south central Indiana, Hart and southeastern Grayson Counties in south central Kentucky, Jefferson and southwestern Oldham Counties in north central Kentucky, northeastern Edmonson and northeastern Barren Counties in south central Kentucky, Hardin County in north central Kentucky, northwestern Metcalfe County in south central Kentucky, Bullitt, west central Nelson, southeastern Meade and Larue Counties in north central Kentucky, including the following locations... Bardstown Junction, Scuffletown, Logsdon Valley, Broad Ford, Austin, Vesta, New Frankfort, Lone Star, Pascal and Rineyville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
